intro: Quercus inopina, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a species of flowering plant in the beech family, Fagaceae. It is native to southern Mexico and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and acorns that mature in one year. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and has a broad, rounded canopy. Its bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age. Quercus inopina is adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in mixed forests and along stream banks.
